p: All the alkaline polymer electrolyte membranes were measured by AC impedance at ambient temperature. Based on the AC impedance spectra ( Figure 8A,B), the bulk resistance Rb of the alkaline polymer electrolyte membranes can be obtained. Figure 8A showed that the Rb was in the order of 0.4–2.2 Ω for alkaline polymer electrolyte membranes which were soaked by KOH solution with various alkaline concentrations. In contrast, Figure 8B showed the Rb was in the range of 0.4–0.7 Ω upon undergoing different immersing time. The relationship between ionic conductivity σ and the impedance Rb is characterized via Equation (1). σ = L/(Rb × A) (1)
